examples: Despite being one of the most accomplished musicians in the world, he never seeks attention or tries to show off his skills - a loaded wagon makes no noise.
I know he's talented, but sometimes it feels like he's just showing off.
The athlete was in great physical shape and wanted to show off his physique, thinking that if you've got it, flaunt it, and posted a picture of himself shirtless on social media.
In the sun-dappled streets of a small town, a proud mother showed off her newborn son.
Wanna show off your beak?
words.defineEn: to act in a way that is intended to impress others
words.defineVi: hành động theo cách nhằm mục đích gây ấn tượng với người khác

examples: The rumor ran through the pack of photographers.
The teacher had a fit when the dog ran through the classroom.
One of those days where you feel like you're running through treacle.
Red wooden horses run through the blood of the people in new Nusnäs, Sweden.
Maybe a river runs through them.
words.defineEn: to go over, read, or explain something quickly
words.defineVi: để đi qua, đọc, hoặc giải thích một cái gì đó một cách nhanh chóng

examples: All right, folks, stick around.
Stick around.
Stick around.
Stick around.
Stick around.
words.defineEn: to remain in a place, often waiting for something
words.defineVi: ở lại một nơi, thường chờ đợi một cái gì đó

examples: Or a big family get together?

Everybody gets together?
words.defineEn: to meet with a person in order to cooperate or socialize
words.defineVi: để gặp gỡ với một người để hợp tác hoặc giao lưu

examples: The next conference will be held in Ohio.
The wood is held in position by a clamp.
To be held in high esteem.
She was arrested and held in custody in a police station.
The army held in Belgium.
words.defineEn: to suppress the expression of your feelings
words.defineVi: để ngăn chặn sự thể hiện cảm xúc của bạn

examples: Biden rolls out the red carpet for French President Macron's state visit.
Since Jake is their only child, Robert and Sarah always roll out the red carpet for him whenever he returns home from college.
We're just popping by for a cup of tea and a quick catch-up, no need to roll out the red carpet!
Timpano dough roll out.
The White House rolled out.
words.defineEn: to officially introduce or launch a new product, service, or system
words.defineVi: để chính thức giới thiệu hoặc ra mắt một sản phẩm, dịch vụ hoặc hệ thống mới

examples: Check in.
Checking in.
Check in.
The sun checks in at minus 27.
First, he checks in with his architects Iktinos and Callicrates.
words.defineEn: to arrive and fill in your name in a hotel or airport
words.defineVi: đến và điền vào tên của bạn trong một khách sạn hoặc sân bay

examples: It filled up time on cable television.
OK, so the water from the WRT tank is filling up the torpedo tube itself.
First things first, we've got ta fill up the tank.
Fill up with it.
It can fill up 270 pints a minute.
words.defineEn: to make something become full
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó trở nên đầy đủ

examples: He tried to stay under the radar as he went about his business.
The harsh conditions of the dead of winter made it difficult for many people to go about their daily lives.
We had gone about fifty miles when the car broke down.
The business consultant said during the meeting that in a business setting, better go about than fall into the ditch, and always be prepared and make informed decisions to avoid costly mistakes.
So I went about it that way as well.
words.defineEn: to carry on or start dealing with an activity
words.defineVi: để tiếp tục hoặc bắt đầu đối phó với một hoạt động

examples: I followed up
He followed up at the Camp David news conference.
That follows up from 30 in 2018.
And they followed up with bereavement scores of families.
- I do wanna follow up on that.
words.defineEn: to do something right after another to increase its chances of success
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó ngay sau khi khác để tăng cơ hội thành công của nó

examples: The soup needed a little more salt to bring out the taste.
A drizzle of honey over a bowl of physalis brings out its natural sweetness even more.
Performing in front of an audience brings out the best in me.
The CEO's promotion to a higher position brought out a more arrogant side of him, demonstrating how honors change manners.
My kids never misbehave when you watch them, so you definitely bring out the best in them!
words.defineEn: to take something out of an enclosed space
words.defineVi: để lấy một cái gì đó ra khỏi một không gian kín

examples: He looked through her belongings in the hope of coming across some information.
He looked through her belongings in the hope of coming across some information.
It's asking a lot, but could you look through Billy's things?
A tea party Nick looked through the doors of the tea room in the Empress Hotel.
Look through its skin.
words.defineEn: to quickly read written material; to examine something quickly
words.defineVi: để đọc nhanh tài liệu bằng văn bản; để kiểm tra một cái gì đó một cách nhanh chóng

examples: The teacher called out our names one by one for attendance.

Pennsylvania’s attorney general called out illegal surveillance of a ballot dropbox in Philadelphia.
The governor's called out the National Guard.
words.defineEn: to order or summon into service
words.defineVi: để đặt hàng hoặc triệu tập vào dịch vụ

examples: The film is set in 18th-century New England.

The novel is set in London in the 1960s.

A spy novel set in Berlin.
words.defineEn: (of something unwelcome or unlikable) to become established or occur, often with a connotation of persistence or difficulty in changing
words.defineVi: (của một cái gì đó không được hoan nghênh hoặc không thích) trở nên ổn định hoặc xảy ra, thường với hàm ý về sự kiên trì hoặc khó thay đổi

examples: We all have to do our bit to help out.
My younger brother is always pleading for me to help out his career, so I threw him a bone and got him a small gig.

They help out other members of their flock.
Always helps out.

words.defineVi: để giúp ai đó, đặc biệt là để giúp họ làm điều gì đó dễ dàng hơn

examples: It will all come out in the wash.

We've certainly had some problems but I think, in the end, it will all come out in the wash.
Everything came out in the wash as the construction workers did their best to repair the bridge.
You can do everything you can to hide this, but everything comes out in the wash.

words.defineVi: (về da của một người) bị bao phủ bởi các đốm hoặc tình trạng tương tự do bị bệnh hoặc dị ứng

examples: My brother always wears a belt with his pants to keep them from falling down.
When Sarah discovered the new TV series, she fell down the rabbit hole and binge-watched all the episodes in one sitting.

The boy and Nick fell down on the floor.
So this huge tree fell down in the back of the property, out in the middle of the jungle.
words.defineEn: to collapse or fall to the ground
words.defineVi: để sụp đổ hoặc rơi xuống đất

examples: The sign must be taken down.

but we took down a drone.
They can take down much bigger ants.

words.defineEn: to bring or move to a lower position
words.defineVi: để mang lại hoặc di chuyển đến một vị trí thấp hơn

examples: They are wrapping up their employees in cotton wool, offering extra benefits and rewards.

The prosecution and defense wrap up their cases in the murder trial of former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin.
Today, prosecutors for the state of Minnesota wrapped up their case.
Tomorrow, the House impeachment managers wrap up their opening arguments.
words.defineEn: to enclose or cover in paper, etc.
words.defineVi: để kèm theo hoặc che trong giấy, vv

examples: People sometimes come for that.
So the information era came for everyone.
A new time is coming for our planet.
And that time came for Tom.
The monster was coming for them.
words.defineEn: to search in order to get or catch something or someone
words.defineVi: để tìm kiếm để có được hoặc bắt một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Suppressors heat up very, very quickly.

In the day's other news: The contest for chair of the Democratic National Committee heated up.
Amazon's battle with Hachette and the authors that Hachette publishes is heating up.

words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó ấm áp hoặc nóng

examples: Her advice fell on deaf ears.

The CEO fell on his sword when widespread corruption in the company was exposed.
words.defineEn: to acquire or be assigned to a new responsibility
words.defineVi: để có được hoặc được giao cho một trách nhiệm mới

examples: I'm excited to try out a new video game that was just released.

Try out different materials and different sizes!

words.defineVi: để thử nghiệm một cái gì đó mới hoặc khác để xem nó tốt hoặc hiệu quả như thế nào
